title: Equality before law
text: The State shall not deny to any person equality before the law or equal protection of the laws within the territory of India.
summary:
• Eq bef law (British concept):
    • Absence of sp priv.s
    • Subjection of all persons equally before law
    • Noone above the law
  • Eq protection of laws (American concept):
    • Eq. of treatment u. eq. circumstances
    • Simiar appln of laws when persons similarly situated
    • Like to be treated alike

  • Where equals and unequals are treated differently, Article 14 does not apply
  • RK Dalmia Case: ‘classification test’ - must have intelligible differentia & rational nexus (classification cannot be arbitrary, artificial, evasive)
  • Maneka Gandhi, 1978: recognised that an inter-relationship exists b.w Art 14, 19, 21.
    • (This case is also k.f effectively bringing concept of ‘due process’ in Art 21)
  • Shayara Bano Case, 2017: 'talaq-e-biddat' (triple talaq) deemed 'manifestly arbitrary' & violative of Art 14
    • Parl also outlawed it via Muslim Woman Act, 2019
